column4: Hi. How large should my swap partition be, having 1 GiB of memory?
the default is fine
I'd like to make the partitions manually.. Would 512 KB be good?
MB? that's fine.
Yes, sorry, MB :-) Thanks
of course, you can put any thing, any where
How do I configure that? In /etc/fstab I think I can only choose one mount point per partition.
of course
you make /var a symlink to somewhere in /home
Okay, thanks, I'll try it. Then I've only got one question left (I hope): Does the Ubuntu installer recognize /home/* folders, so that I can keep my files when re-installing?
if you tell the partitioner to mount it on /home, yes
So when I make a new user in the installer with the same name as in the old installation, I can use the same files?
yes
Okay, great. :-)
as long as you read the upgrade noties, no
beat whoever made the broken backup
then copy the permissions from another ubuntu machine
No, I don't do self-chastisement :-)

the vast majority of things in /var are not owned by random users
most is root, but applications create various things under there owned by them
